prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples,"Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(PCAtools)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", sheet = 1, col_names = TRUE)

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)

# Transpose count table
count_table <- t(count_table)

# Add gene names as row names
rownames(count_table) <- count_table[,1]
count_table <- count_table[,-1]

# Add sample ids as row names
rownames(annotation_data) <- annotation_data[,1]
annotation_data <- annotation_data[,-1]

# Select variables for PCA
pca_data <- count_table[rownames(annotation_data),]

# Find genes specific for each group using statistical tests
group_specific_genes <- vector("list", length(unique(annotation_data$group)))

for (i in 1:length(unique(annotation_data$group))) {
  group <- unique(annotation_data$group)[i]
  group_samples <- annotation_data[annotation_data$group == group, ]
  group_data <- pca_data[rownames(group_samples), ]
  
  group_specific_genes[[i]] <- apply(group_data, 1, function(x) {
    t.test(x ~ group_samples$group)$p.value
  }) < 0.05
}

# Combine group-specific genes
combined_specific_genes <- do.call(cbind, group_specific_genes)
genes <- rownames(count_table)
group_specific_genes <- genes[rowSums(combined_specific_genes) == length(unique(annotation_data$group))]

# Perform PCA using group-specific genes
pca_result <- prcomp(t(pca_data[group_specific_genes,]))

# Plot PCA colored by group
plot_pca(pca_result, color_by = annotation_data$group)
```
Note: Make sure to replace "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx" and "SRP021193.colData.tsv" with the correct file paths.
